name: Ginger Tea House @ West Park BizCentral

reviews.text:
Very big industrial building. Depending on your location, mobile reception is sometimes limited.

Directions in carparks can be improved, especially the lifts. Cos depending on which part of the building, it can be levels 1-11 and the other starts at 1, 2, 2M and so on. So for visitors, it‚Äôll be confusing.

2 canteens to choose from.
Canteen 1 = Ginger Tea House
Fully air conditioned and also mean you‚Äôll smell like a canteen too.

Food wise, the chicken rice is a definite to go for stall. Economical rice is not too bad, although the ‚Äúeconomical rice‚Äù may no longer be a valid statement.

Former Malay stall is good, the current one is so-so. If you‚Äôre feeling rich, go for the Ayam penyet and you‚Äôll get cutthroat price at $8 üò±

Personally, I‚Äôll give the Thai and Japanese food a miss.

The beverage is so-so with the coffee kinda thin. Currently, the beverage stall is doing a price match against canteen 2.

Personally, I‚Äôll patronise canteen 1 under ‚Äúforced circumstances‚Äù.

Canteen 2 = MX Cafe
Non aircon, more choices for Chinese food.

Downside, no Malay food and just 1 Indian stall.

Beverage is definitely way better.

Disclaimer: Info correct at time of review, November 2024.

First time I was here I ate prata here with fish curry, it was very salty.
The second time I ate mee soto, it was mediocre. Not to mention the drinks are very pricey. üò§

Very bright signage where you will never miss out this spot walking pass it.
food choice are plenty
Japanese,Indian, Chinese, Thai, Malay food you you name it all.
food wise are not bad.
must try the roasted chicken rice or duck or char view! super nice!
the drink choice are also plenty of it.
lemon tea, bandung, tea halia .

super spoilt for choices!
the varieties of food choices here. Thai food, Japanese food , quite long queue roasted chicken rice stalls! the drink plenty  of choices for you to choose. the staffs are friendly.

Canteen is very clean and airy. Excellent!  This is added point for me.  With aircon and additional ceiling fans. Served good traditional coffee. I tried mee rebus and long tong from the malay stall. Long tong is very good, the vegetable curry well done. Hubby said the chicken rice next to this malay stall is good too. The economical rice stall has a lot of variety, looks good but i can't eat anymore. üòÖ  Got to come back and try the Indian food too!
